Coaching for Collaboration

Agile coaching

A thriving agile team speaks up, asks questions, reflects and learns from mistakes. They learn the technical chops to share a codebase, respond to change, and deliver frequently. They dig in to really understand what's required, and collaborate to create something the customers and stakeholders will love.

Find out how our coaching can help.

Retrospective facilitation

Retrospectives can be the key to agile improvement. Or they can be yet another boring, useless meeting that takes away from coding time. Which are yours?

Imagine a retro that uncovers hidden or deep-rooted issues, inspires the team to take ownership of their process, and encourages action to improve things.

Find out how our retro facilitation can help.

Retrospective facilitator workshop

Good retrospectives are vital to agile's learning and adaptation culture. And facilitators with strong skills make for good retros.

A group of skilled facilitators in your organization can provide neutral facilitation for each other's teams. As a community of practice, they can learn together and give each other support for the challenges any good facilitator will face.

About retrospective facilitator workshops.

Pair programming workshop

"I didn't become a programmer because of my social skills."

Agile nerds need to collaborate. To enable a shared codebase, we learn to write clean, well-crafted object-oriented code, and we often do it in pairs.

But pair programming is harder than it sounds. We need skills to make it possible. We are technical and we are human. Let's get better at being both.

About pair programming workshops.
